thread.title: Kassena-Nankana assembly members must work diligently
thread.title_full: Kassena-Nankana assembly members must work diligently

title: Kassena-Nankana assembly members must work diligently
text:
Politics | 16 October 2015 17:00 CET Kassena-Nankana assembly members must work diligently By GNA 
Navrongo (U/E), Oct 15, GNA - The Municipal Chief Executive (MCE) for the Kassena-Nankana Municipality, Dr Stanislaus Alu Kadingdi, has urged new the assembly Members to avail themselves and work diligently to enable the assembly to attain its desired progress. 
The MCE made the call when he met with the Assembly members at Navrongo. 
He said although the National Democratic Congress-led government, through its social interventions, had helped to reduce the development deficit of the municipality, there was the need for the people to fulfill their responsibilities by contributing to bring development to the area. 
The two contestants, Mr. Amos Ayuure and Mr. Adongo Joseph, who vied for the PM slot in the Kassena-Nankana Municipal Assembly, could not meet the constitutional requirement of two-thirds majority of the total votes cast. 
The 49 Assembly members comprising 34 elected members and 15 government appointees were earlier on sworn into office. 
In another development, Mr George Abavelim, retained his position as the Presiding Member for the Builsa North District. 
In his victory speech, he pledged to work hand in hand with the District Chief Executive to continue to execute the development projects to put smiles on the faces of the people in the District. 
Forty-five Assembly members comprising 31 elected members and 14 government appointees were elected in Builsa North. 
GNA SAM/
